docs.abstract: The concept of a militarily guided democracy without democrats is familiar in South Asia.
docs.snippet: The concept of a militarily guided democracy without democrats is familiar in South Asia.
docs.lead_paragraph: Promoting democracy, especially in Islamic countries, is supposed to be a major goal of President Bush’s foreign policy. But his administration has raised little protest as Bangladesh — until January the world’s fifth most populous democracy — has been transformed into its second most populous military dictatorship.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

docs.abstract: In a country so precariously balanced, two degrees meant the difference between life and death.
docs.snippet: In a country so precariously balanced, two degrees meant the difference between life and death.

docs.abstract: DHAKA, Bangladesh — Imagine, if you will, a country marooned between a snowy mountain range and a churning sea. The country is small, a thumbprint on a vast continent. It holds the youngest and largest delta in the world. This means the landscape is fickle, the rivers often shifting and swallowing giant swaths of land.
docs.lead_paragraph: DHAKA, Bangladesh — Imagine, if you will, a country marooned between a snowy mountain range and a churning sea. The country is small, a thumbprint on a vast continent. It holds the youngest and largest delta in the world. This means the landscape is fickle, the rivers often shifting and swallowing giant swaths of land.

docs.abstract: Villagers try to pick up the pieces following the devastation of Cyclone Sidr.
docs.snippet: Villagers try to pick up the pieces following the devastation of Cyclone Sidr.
docs.lead_paragraph: Villagers try to pick up the pieces following the devastation of Cyclone Sidr.

docs.abstract: Unesco said that the cyclone that struck southern Bangladesh last month destroyed 40 percent of the Sundarbans, one of the world’s largest mangrove forests and a World Heritage site.
docs.snippet: Unesco said that the cyclone that struck southern Bangladesh last month destroyed 40 percent of the Sundarbans, one of the world’s largest mangrove forests and a World Heritage site.
docs.lead_paragraph: Unesco said that the cyclone that struck southern Bangladesh last month and killed 3,000 people also destroyed 40 percent of the Sundarbans, one of the world’s largest mangrove forests and a World Heritage site. The Sundarbans, on the delta of the Ganges, Brahmaputra and Meghna Rivers, is home to several endangered species, including the Bengal tiger, and is a source of livelihood for hundreds of thousands of people who subsist on fishing and shrimping. Unesco estimated that regeneration of the Sundarbans ecosystem would take 10 to 15 years.

headline.main: Bangladesh: Sundarbans Devastated by November Cyclone
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh: Sundarbans Devastated By November Cyclone

docs.abstract: The United Nations estimated that a million people had been left homeless, many of them in remote areas without predictable food supplies.
docs.snippet: The United Nations estimated that a million people had been left homeless, many of them in remote areas without predictable food supplies.
docs.lead_paragraph: The number of people left dead after the powerful cyclone that swept through Bangladesh on Thursday rose to more than 3,100 yesterday, the government said. The United Nations estimated that a million people had been left homeless, many of them in remote areas without predictable food supplies.

docs.abstract: KHATACHIRA, Bangladesh — The wind whipped through the sky. The river swelled above the tree line. And in a flash, Mamataz Begum's youngest child, barely 2 years old, was swept from her arms, as tidal waves smashed through the fragile mud homes of this village and scooped up everything in its watery arms.
docs.lead_paragraph: KHATACHIRA, Bangladesh — The wind whipped through the sky. The river swelled above the tree line. And in a flash, Mamataz Begum's youngest child, barely 2 years old, was swept from her arms, as tidal waves smashed through the fragile mud homes of this village and scooped up everything in its watery arms.

docs.abstract: PATHARGHATA, Bangladesh — Bangladesh sought more foreign aid Tuesday to help thousands of survivors of Cyclone Sidr after the storm mauled villages along the country's coast and killed more than 3,100 people, according to an official tally that was expected to rise.
docs.lead_paragraph: PATHARGHATA, Bangladesh — Bangladesh sought more foreign aid Tuesday to help thousands of survivors of Cyclone Sidr after the storm mauled villages along the country's coast and killed more than 3,100 people, according to an official tally that was expected to rise.

docs.abstract: DHAKA, Bangladesh — Clashes between the Bangladeshi police and students demanding an end to emergency rule spilled into the streets of the capital Wednesday, prompting the government to impose an indefinite curfew in Dhaka and six other major cities.
docs.lead_paragraph: DHAKA, Bangladesh — Clashes between the Bangladeshi police and students demanding an end to emergency rule spilled into the streets of the capital Wednesday, prompting the government to impose an indefinite curfew in Dhaka and six other major cities.

docs.abstract: DHAKA, Bangladesh — Violent clashes between the police and students demanding an end to emergency rule left about 100 people wounded at university campuses across Bangladesh on Wednesday, witnesses and news reports said.
docs.lead_paragraph: DHAKA, Bangladesh — Violent clashes between the police and students demanding an end to emergency rule left about 100 people wounded at university campuses across Bangladesh on Wednesday, witnesses and news reports said.
